intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: The Stone of Frelia has already been taken care of... How is it the Stone of Renais continues to elude us? Glen. Valter. Find the children of Renais. Find them and take from them the bracelets that they wear. Glen, take Eirika. Valter, take Ephraim. Find them. Conquer them.

intro.speaker: Glen
intro.line: Yes, Your Majesty...

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Ha ha... Eirika, eh? She's a ripe little peach. And her brother, Ephraim... He's better prey than I'd imagined. I can feel my blood rushing at the thought. This might be fun after all.

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Caellach. Riev. Shatter the remaining Sacred Stones. Caellach, take Jehanna. Riev, take Rausten. Go. Crush the Sacred Stones they house.

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh... As you will. I'll begin making arrangements for Rausten's downfall immediately...

intro.speaker: Caellach
intro.line: Bah! Why am I stuck with Jehanna? Accursed ill luck. I became a mercenary to escape that wretched place, and now I must go back?

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Duessel. Go to Frelia. Punish the Frelian army and their commander, Ephraim.

intro.speaker: Duessel
intro.line: Begging your pardon, Your Majesty... Now that you've conquered Renais, what are your plans for her citizens? The country is in ruins. Thieves and bandits swagger about as if--

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Leave them...

intro.speaker: Duessel
intro.line: But, sire...

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: Sir Duessel. The emperor has spoken. Please...

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Selena. Remain here in the capital. We shall have new orders for you shortly.

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: Understood.

intro.speaker: Duessel
intro.line: Please, Your Majesty! Grant me the privilege of a single question.

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: ...... ...You vex us.

intro.speaker: Duessel
intro.line: Your Majesty, you know that I will gladly lay down my life for an honorable cause! But these orders--and all of our recent actions--they are not just! If I saw any way in which this invasion protected Grado, I would hold my tongue. But now, Renais is left ungoverned to drown in chaos, and we gain nothing! Why do you wage this war? What is it you hope to achieve? You've sent our men to fight and die for nothing! This isn't war--it's murder!

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: ...Duessel. This decision is ours to make. You have no voice in these matters.

intro.speaker: Duessel
intro.line: Punish me if you must, Your Majesty, but I implore you! Please rethink this!! If this continues, Grado will--

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Duessel. Go to Frelia. Crush the Frelian army and he who leads them, Prince Ephraim.

intro.speaker: Duessel
intro.line: Your Majesty!

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Have you gone deaf? Duessel. Go to Frelia. Crush the Frelian army and he who leads them, Prince Ephraim.

intro.speaker: Duessel
intro.line: ...... Yes, Your Majesty.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Commander Gheb! We captured a pegasus knight snooping about outside.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Let me go! Stop it! That hurts!

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: Ooooh... You didn't tell me she was such a treat for the eyes. Heh heh... This is a prize worth catching.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: I-I came for Ephraim. If you do anything to me, he will not be merciful.

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: Heh heh... I like her. Throw her in a cell. I'll spend the evening giving her a thorough interrogation. Heh heh heh...

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: You b-beast!

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: That is Fort Rigwald. It has stood unconquered for generations. Its defenses are legendary. It is the jewel of Grado's fortifications, and its walls have never been breached.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: And if we don't capture it, any attack on the capital will be pointless. Tell me what you see, Seth. Do we have the power to take it?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: It's a daunting task. The enemy has the advantage of both terrain and numbers.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: But what about in morale?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Do you suspect the soldiers may be unwilling to fight?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Anything's possible. This war is a sudden thing, but Grado and Renais had long been friendly. Before these hostilities, our nations were allies... No, closer even than that. This is the emperor's war, but the hearts of the people are not so swift to change. For example, General Duessel, one of the Imperial Three they call Obsidian... He was the one who taught me what I know about fighting with the lance. Duessel's sympathies are sure to remain with Renais--and with our cause. He is loyal to Grado, but he has no love of war. I'm sure he will speak with me.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: And more than that, Prince Lyon has been my friend for years. He can be timid at times and perhaps was unable to oppose his father in this. But I'm sure he detests this fighting and shares my opinions.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Prince Ephraim...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: There must be some Grado soldiers within the castle who do not want to fight. If we can rush the fort and seize the throne room, I believe they will surrender.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: ...Optimism here may be deadly. Still, it's a far better plan than challenging the main army face-to-face.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Eirika is on her way to Rausten to help end this conflict. We cannot afford to wait here for much longer. We must take this fort and then press on to the capital itself. Let's go!

intro.speaker: Fighter
intro.line: Attack! We're under attack! ...Looks to be Frelian troops. Their commander is... Prince Ephraim of Renais!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Renais? This whole thing stinks. My younger sister and her husband were living in Renais... What is the emperor thinking, starting this war? I think--

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: ...Hey.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Ah!

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: Yeah, I heard you. Talking about not fighting, are you? Losing your nerve? The punishment for treason is harsh. You'll burn at the stake.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: B-but-- It's not just me! Even General Duessel is opposed to this war!

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: Duessel? You'd side with that washed-up coward? And who is your commanding officer? Is it Duessel? Come on, out with it!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Y-you are, Sir Gheb.

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: That's right. So that should make it clear whose orders you follow, eh? You got that, dolts? If you do, then shut up and get in formation. No one cares whether you minnows live or die anyway. Got it?

intro.speaker: Amelia
intro.line: W-wait a moment! That's a horrible thing to say!

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: And who are you supposed to be? Your name! Out with it!

intro.speaker: Amelia
intro.line: I-I'm Amelia... I was assigned to this fort today! I am a soldier of Grado. I am not a slave!

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: What's this now? You're a girl? You've got a lot of nerve talking like that to your commander, recruit. Looks like I'm going to have to teach you about the chain of command.

intro.speaker: Amelia
intro.line: Ah...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Commander Gheb! Enemy troops approaching!

intro.speaker: Gheb
intro.line: Grrr! Stinking interruptions... Form up, you useless worms. Don't let those dogs near the throne. Grado cannot afford to lose a brilliant tactician of my stature! No one will blink if any of you worthless toads dies. But if I die-- You should be happy to fight, kill, and die in my service!

intro.speaker: Amelia
intro.line: I became a soldier to honor the emperor, General Duessel, and the people of Grado. But this...this is wrong!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: That's the lot of a soldier. We're pawns in the games of kings and emperors. We fight as ordered, and we die as ordered. That's it. C'mon, time to go.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Oh, what a fool I've been... I came all this way to help Ephraim, and I end up getting captured again. That General Gheb had the creepiest eyes...and that laugh! Oh! Hurry, Ephraim... Please. Hurry and rescue me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: You...you're a girl?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: Ah! Don't make fun of me! I'm a soldier of Grado! Prepare yourself, Frelian dog!

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: W-wait a minute!

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: Oof...

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: Are, are you all right? It's not surprising you fell over from that stance. Can you get up?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: Sh-shut up!

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: Did you hurt your knee? I know how it feels. I did it often enough as a recruit myself. To be honest, I still do it more than I should.

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: I'm Franz. I'm a Knight of Renais. What's your name?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: I'm Amelia.

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: Amelia, do you think I could ask you to surrender? This may be odd, but I really have no desire to fight you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: I get the feeling you don't want to fight either. Am I right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: I... B-but... I've heard Prince Ephraim takes female prisoners and uses them as palace slaves. If I surrender, will I be forced to work in the palace, too?

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: N-no, don't be silly! Prince Ephraim would never do such a thing...I think...

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: You think?

recruit-talk.speaker: Franz
recruit-talk.line: No, he wouldn't! Of course not. You have my word of honor.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: ...Well, you seem sincere. I'll trust you, Franz.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: You're a Grado soldier? But you're just a child.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: I am not a child! I'm a soldier of Grado, and I will defeat every soldier of Frelia I meet!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Is that so? Guess I'm ready then.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: Um...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: ...Is that the stance you're going to use? You'll drop your lance that way. I'm Prince Ephraim of Renais. Why don't you surrender and come with me?

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: Wha-what are you going to do to me?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Calm down. As long as you don't try to stab me, I won't do a thing to harm you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Amelia
recruit-talk.line: You lie! You're a liar! Everyone knows about Prince Ephraim of Renais. He's a beast who attacks any woman he sees...

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: ......Right, this has gone far enough. I am not going to hurt you. If you're scared, throw down your weapon and run away. But...if you're willing to listen, I'd like to ask for your help. You must realize this whole war is madness, right? Something is wrong in Grado.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Tana?! What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: I came here in hopes of helping you in some way. But while I was looking for you, I got captured by Grado troops.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Is that so? Well, I'm glad to see you're unharmed. Tana, you should head back to Castle Frelia immediately. King Hayden must be worried about you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: No! Ephraim, I came all this way so I could help you!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: And yet, here I am, helping you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: Ah, well... Yes, that may be true, but-- But I've been so worried about you, Ephraim!

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: I see. Oh, please don't look at me with those teary eyes. If you're really determined to help, then you're welcome to come with us. But you must promise me not to try anything reckless.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: Ephraim... Thank you. I knew that you would understand how I feel.

boss.speaker: Gheb
boss.line: Y-you wench... You're that recruit, aren't you? Do you think you can betray me and get away with it?

boss.speaker: Amelia
boss.line: Your threats no longer hold any power over me. I-I am not your pawn!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Prince Ephraim, the rest of the enemy troops have been routed.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Bring me one of the prisoners. I have a question I need answered.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I'm going to ask you a question. If you've no wish to answer, remain silent. If you wish this conflict to end quickly, however, you will cooperate.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: ...... ...What do you want?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Why has Grado invaded Renais?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: ...I can't say. This war began on the emperor's orders. Soldiers like me haven't the foggiest idea what he's after.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Then tell me this: where is General Duessel?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: In the capital. The general's been opposed to this war from the start. He's been pleading with the emperor for days now, but the emperor ignores him. They say some are questioning the general's loyalty. He's putting his standing--and his life-- in danger by being so vocal.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Is that so... Well, it appears General Duessel remains the same true man I knew before. What about Prince Lyon? Where's he been through all of this? Why didn't he do anything to temper his father's aggression?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: ...... According to rumors... Emperor Vigarde was convinced to start this war by none other than the prince himself.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: What did you say? That's ridiculous! I know Prince Lyon well. No one hates fighting more than he does. He would never do anything to trigger all this bloodshed!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Prince Ephraim, please calm down.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: ...I'm sorry.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We leave the prisoners and the fort to the Frelian troops. Seth, I intend for us to press on toward the capital. At some point, I expect we'll find either Duessel or Lyon. I'm sure we can convince them to join us in stopping Emperor Vigarde.

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Understood. But I have misgivings, my prince. General Duessel and Prince Lyon are both men of Grado. If we are forced into conflict with them...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: It won't happen. Duessel was my teacher, and I know he is a man of character. And I've known Lyon since we were children. He, Eirika, and I are old friends.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I understand your concerns. If worse comes to worst and steel is drawn, I will not hesitate. I'll fight and kill anyone who thinks to oppose me. Are you satisfied, Seth?

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: Yes... I apologize for my rudeness. Your father is gone, and that means you are king of Renais. There is no other. I just ask that you not throw yourself into needless danger.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I hear you. The decisions I make affect more than my own life. Once this war is finished, I will rebuild Renais with Eirika. That is my mission.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Myrrh.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You must return to Frelia. I cannot take you any farther on this journey.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: What? No. I want to stay with you...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: No, Myrrh. I'm continuing on to the Grado capital. It's going to be very dangerous. I can't protect you--not as well as I'd like to, anyway.

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: Everything comes from that direction. I can feel my lost dragonstone... And that's not all. The dark energy still flows unchecked... I cannot go home while it stains the air...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: Please, Ephraim.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: ...Very well. Ah, I simply cannot refuse you anything. Your eyes remind me too much of Eirika. You must not stray from my side, do you understand?

end.speaker: Myrrh
end.line: Yes, I will not stray...

end.speaker: Vigarde
end.line: Selena. Your orders.

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: I am ready, Your Majesty. In your service, I am prepared to do--

end.speaker: Vigarde
end.line: Duessel has left for Bethroen. Take a battalion and follow him.

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: Understood. When I arrive, I will place my troops at his disposal.

end.speaker: Vigarde
end.line: No... You will not. You will strike Duessel down.

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: Wha...

end.speaker: Vigarde
end.line: Duessel is a traitor. He has abandoned his country and sided with Renais. The punishment for treason is death.

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: B-but... General Duessel a traitor? That's just not possible! There must be a mistake...

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: No... I did not mean that you are mistaken, Your Majesty. But...but...

end.speaker: Vigarde
end.line: Selena. You have your orders. You will execute Duessel.

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: ...... ...Your Majesty. Will you allow me to ask you a question?

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: When Your Majesty saw fit to make me a general, you shared with me some words of wisdom. I remember the moment quite clearly. You told me the role of an imperial general is that of the shield, not the blade. We are here to protect our citizens, you said--not to threaten our neighbors. I have never forgotten your words, Your Majesty. I have held them to my breast. They govern my every action as general. Your Majesty, that sentiment is still alive, and--

end.speaker: Vigarde
end.line: Go.

end.speaker: Selena
end.line: ...... I humbly acknowledge your orders. Your Majesty... I am the empire's servant. I am Your Majesty's vassal. I am General Selena, the Fluorspar of the Grado Empire.
